headline: Tips on finding and joining a research group remotely
text: Dear HE careers, I am a PhD student (final submission awaiting result) and a mother of two babies based at home. I would like to participate in a research group, preferably remotely, in my subject area - behavioural economics - with a view to discussion and possible collaboration. Do you know of this happening anywhere or how I may make contact in this regard? Or do you have any other suggestions for active participation whilst working from home in this field? Yours sincerely,Roberta Powell-Long, Australia  Tweet, post on LinkedIn or Facebook or send your queries to he.careers.clinic@theguardian.com, with HE careers clinic in the subject line. Chosen problems will appear both in the newsletter and on the site where you'll be able to share your views and experiences. Looking for a job in HE?
